alert.note: Alert for Perry; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:47PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Perry, northwestern Washington, Morgan and northeastern Athens Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1147 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shawnee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Lexington, Glouster, McConnelsville, Shawnee, Chesterhill, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning, Stockport, Bristol, Hemlock, Rendville, Burr Oak State Park and Hackney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
